climtools.cmor module¶

climtools.cmor.check_neccessary_cmor(data)¶

Checks if all the neccessary attributes and coordinates exists for saving in cmor format

Parameters

data (xarray.DataArray or xarray.Dataset) – Dataset investigated

climtools.cmor.cmor_save(data, parent_directory)¶

Save a dataarray or dataset in conform with cmor regulations under the parent directory

Parameters

  • data (xarray.DataArray or xarray.Dataset) – Data to be saved

  • parent_directory (string) – Path to the parent folder where the CMIP-folder structure starts

_summary_

Parameters

  • variable_id (str) – cmor variable id

  • table_id (str) – cmor_table id

  • model_id (str) – cmor model id

  • experiment_id (str) – cmor experiment id

  • realization_id (str) – cmor realization id

  • grid_label (str) – cmor grid label

  • time_range_string (str) – cmor time range string

Returns

cmor filename

climtools.cmor.gen_cmor_path_and_filename(data, version_id)¶

Generates a cmor compliant path and filename for a given dataset. Data must have the neccessary attributes

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset or xarray.DataArray) – Dataset for which the path and filename should be generated

  • version_id (str) – String indicating the version id used for this dataset

Returns: A tuple (path, file) where path is the relative path and file the cmor filename.

climtools.cmor.get_time_range_string(data)¶

Returns a time_range string for a given dataset

Parameters

data (xarray.Dataset or xarray.DataArray) – Dataset for which the time_range string will be created.

Returns

time_range string

Return type

str

climtools.cmor.get_time_string(time, temporal_resolution)¶

Returns the string for a timestamp and a given temporal resolution

Parameters

  • time (cftime.datetime) – Timestamp

  • temporal_resolution (str) – Resolution

Returns

string of timestamp

Return type

str

Updates or assings a new attribute “process_id” to the dataset in order to track changes

Parameters

  • process_string (string) – String that indicates the update that has been done on the data

climtools.spatial module¶

climtools.spatial.apply_mask(data, mask)¶

Applies a mask to a datast for all variables that have the same dimensions as the mask

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Dataset which should be masked

  • mask (xarray.DataArray) – Mask

Returns

Masked data

Return type

xarray.Dataset

climtools.spatial.gen_lonlatbox_mask(data, longitude_min, longitude_max, latitude_min, latitude_max, latitude_dim='lat', longitude_dim='lon')¶

Generates a mask for a longitude and latitude box for a given dataset. Longitude has to be in [0,360]

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Dataset for which mask is generated

  • longitude_min (_type_) – Minimum longitude (Minimum not included)

  • longitude_max (_type_) – Maximum longitude (Maximum not included)

  • latitude_min (_type_) – Minimum latitude (Minimum not included)

  • latitude_max (_type_) – Maximum latitude (Maximum not included)

  • latitude_dim (str, optional) – _description_. Defaults to “lat”.

  • longitude_dim (str, optional) – _description_. Defaults to “lon”.

Returns

Mask

Return type

xarray.DataArray

climtools.spatial.sellonlatbox(data, longitude_min, longitude_max, latitude_min, latitude_max, latitude_dim='lat', longitude_dim='lon')¶

Selects points of a given dataset that are in between the boundaries defined by latitude and longitudes mininmums and maximums

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Input dataset.

  • longitude_min (float) – Minimum longitude

  • longitude_max (float) – Maximum longitude

  • latitude_min (float) – Minimum latitude

  • latitude_max (float) – Maximum latitude

  • latitude_dim (str, optional) – Name of the latitude dimension. Defaults to “lat”.

  • longitude_dim (str, optional) – Name of the longitude dimension. Defaults to “lon”.

Returns

Dataset with masked values

Return type

xarray Dataset

  • dimensions (list[str]) – Dimension string or list of dimenstion strings

climtools.stat.cal_weighted_anom(data, weights)¶

Calculates the weighted anomaly for a given dataset

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Dataset for which weighted mean should be calculated

  • weights (xarray.DataArray) – Dataset of weights. Dimension of weights determine the average dimensions

Returns

weighted anom over given dimension

xarray Dataset

climtools.temporal.cal_rolling_time_mean(data, time_dim='time', window=10)¶

Calculates the rolling time mean for a given dataset

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Dataset for which to calculate the rolling mean

  • time_dim (str, optional) – Dimension over which rolling average is calculated. Defaults to time.

  • window (int, optional) – Length of the rolling window. Defaults to 10.

Returns

Rolling averaged data. Nan values are dropped.

Return type

xarray.Dataset

climtools.temporal.get_temporal_resolution(data)¶

Returns the temporal resolution of a given xarray object from the time_bnds variable :param data: Input Dataset must contain at least the dimension “time_bnds” :type data: Dataset

Returns

Name of the temporal resolution detected

Return type

str

climtools.temporal.is_leap_year(time)¶

Checks whether a given cf.Datetime is actually a leap year. Function based on https://github.com/Unidata/cftime/blob/master/src/cftime/_cftime.pyx

Parameters

time (cftime.datetime) – Datetime to check

climtools.temporal.temporal_downsampling(data, target_resolution)¶

This function downsamples (averages) a given dataset to a given target resolution. The target resolutions must be coarser than the time resolution of the dataset provided.py

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – Input Dataset. Must contain dimension time as well as the variable time_bnds for inferring the resolution

  • target_resolution (string) – Target Resolution.

Returns

Dataset with a new temporal resolution

Return type

xarray.Dataset

climtools.utils module¶

climtools.utils.add_history(data, processing_message)¶

Appends a new message with timestamp to the history attribute of a dataset

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset or xarray.DataArray) – dataset or dataarray for which history is to be changed

  • processing_message (str) – Message describing the processing step

  • processing_message (string) – Message describing the processing step
